Now

I currently handle communications at Are.na. Here are a few of the projects I've worked on:

  • A crowd investment campaign which raised $270,000 from Are.na members and the public

  • The biweekly Are.na Dispatch newsletter featuring articles, wisdom, and channels from the community

  • "How you use the internet mindfully?" â€“ an essay series, book, resource collection, and workshop produced in collaboration with The Creative Independent


Previously

I used to work at Consortia, a research-based design and strategy office. Our clients included Audi, Harvard Graduate School of Design, Chicago Architecture Biennial, the Graham Foundation, Louis Vuitton, and the Annenberg Trust. I graduated from Bowdoin College in 2015.


Writing

I write occasionally about urbanism and design. Here are a few clips:

  • A field guide to branded urban space (CityLab)

  • On Frank Gehry and the "future of prisons" (Archinect)

  • How the Chicago Tribune Tower Competition changed architecture forever (Chicago Architecture Biennial blog)
